Now I understand that the Olympic people need to make mula to pay for the clean-up in Athens and everything that goes with hosting the Olympics...
 after all they had to put all those dogs to sleep... but I digress
 I am not sure how I feel about THIS emoticon_confused 
 I am torn between both sides to this..
 I would like to know how you guys feel :)

Ever since I saw and heard that pompous jackass Juan Antonio Bull-Loan-E Sammawich, I have percieved the Olympic Committee as a bunch of crooked, stuffed-shirt snobs. The Olympics offer a great deal of good to the world and is to me the greatest source of worldwide peaceful competition and friendship building known to man.
 
 Too bad it's being run by such control freaks.
 
 I can see keeping logos of non-sponsoring companies off of the athletes, but the fans should be able to wear whatever they please.
 
 For many years, there was a cafe here called "The Olympic Cafe", a quaint little hole-in-the-wall place with good food and a long history. They were forced to change their name when the OC took rights to the word "olympic". What a travesty.
Anastasia

i dont have a problem with the stoping the "wrong" brands of food and drink, a lot of venues will not alow you to bring in any food or drink.

 I understand that... 
 but clothing in the stands? 
 I realize that Athens has a 8 billion dollar tab for holding this event, and who knows how long that will take to pay off...
 I just think there should be limits is all...
 I heard on the radio this morning the average income there is 12k a year emoticon_frazzled
emclean
i thought the hiding of logos was for those involved with the compititon, and th efood/ drink was for the fans.
Anastasia

i thought the hiding of logos was for those involved with the compititon, and th efood/ drink was for the fans.

 No it was for everyone, they said fans would either have to take off the offensive attire or turn it inside out.
 and no water from any non olympic vendor could come in as well.
Big Orn

Yea - it's the spectators that will have to turn their clothes inside out, throw away their drink bottles (I suppose they can keep the drink).
 Someone made the promise I suppose, someone on the committee, that if the sponsors would support the Olympics, no other trade name would be allowed inside.
 
 I would just refuse to go, but that’s not the solution. The Olympics have become an indulgence, not unlike most of our favorite TV channels (reality TV). The OC has gotten to the point that it’s not the sports (as evident by the particular events) that they support, but are looking out only for themselves. Greed has taken precedence over entertainment.
 
 It reminds me of the young girls’ beauty contests where the mothers have gone completely crazy over the competition and have forgotten the reasons behind it.

i will stand be what i said about the food / drink. if i was there ant told o would either have to remove my shirt or turn it inside out, i would remove it, let the cameras get a shot of my fish belly white belly, same for my pants, i think i woul hurt there advrotising more that way. (or give my ticket to some 500 poung guy to go in with somr small speedo's)

I just sometimes think enough is enough..how far will it go

 Do you think the NBA should stay out of the Olympics... I am personally embarrassed for the good old USA and our lack of support in the basketball portion of the Olympics....
 What is up with Kidd not showing up and others who felt the terror aspect was too much for them??
 Give me a break! All the other athletes felt it important enough to come..
 I just fear that it is no longer the Olympics we all once knew.. I have to admit last night watching my heart was just not into it, although it could have been I was tired...
 I want that warm gushy feeling you get..like when you watched Seabiscuit.
 I have a huge heart and I will shed a tear at the drop of a hat...Does anyone else have this lack of feeling this time around?

 I have seen basketball turn into something I literally hate, Olympics or not. I just can't see the sport in it anymore. It’s become a show-off/watch me thing. I hope that true basketball comes back someday. But, still, I think the NBA should stay out of the Olympics.
 
I want that warm gushy feeling you get..like when you watched Seabiscuit.
 I have a huge heart and I will shed a tear at the drop of a hat...Does anyone else have this lack of feeling this time around?

 To me, it's been that way for the last couple of seasons, really. The spirit of the games; the wholeheartedness and zeal has gone, IMO.
 
 Maybe there's a drop in competition due to factors out of our earshot? I don't mean in rivalries and game-playing, but true competition.
 I can remember the whole family gathering around the TV and watching. Now, not a soul speaks of it.
 
 It is sad, huh?

 well I think for NBA players to be in the Olympics is not the high point of their career...For all others they have worked their whole lives for this moment to shine or NOT!

 How come they dont know how to show respect for the USA, the very country that made their rock star lives even possible...
